After carefully following his instructions, I felt a sense of relief. The bite had already caused some swelling, and I knew I needed to act quickly. As I prepared the snake, I couldn’t help but wonder about the superstitions surrounding such practices. Some believed that eating a snake that had bitten you could cure the venom, while others warned of dire consequences. I had no time for such beliefs, only for the need to stay alive. After roasting a piece of the snake, I ate it, hoping it would help. Hours passed, and to my relief, the swelling began to subside. The next day, I was still alive, and the bite seemed to have healed. From that day on, I never forgot Jim’s advice, and I always carried a knife with me, ready to act quickly in case of such emergencies. This experience taught me the importance of being prepared and following sound advice in the wild.
